```{
  "name": "midab-app",
  "srcDir": ".",
  "platformVersion": "2023.2"
}```
But on the web interface its defaulting to 2023.1 and not letting my use serverless functions
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C04AY1H2204/p1707319922838399>

Did this and now it won't even deploy

```[ERROR] The build failed due to an internal error with id `c1384455-a6d1-44e8-a868-51133ecca516`. Try uploading it again. If the problem persists, contact HubSpot support with the error id.```
I did the fixed mentioned above but now get an error when uploading so it won't let me upload at all. Any other changes you did here?
^ I haven't tried this update yet but I will later today and will let you know if I run into the same issue
Do you know if your portal is NA or EU?
I think this one is NA
I followed the steps above but still see the same warning message showing 2023.1 instead of 2
global cli version is 5.1.3, deleted node modules, removed from package.json
Hi Andrey. Would you mind sharing your portal id and project name? You can DM me the info.
Hey, can someone please confirm when I can use serverless functions and how I need to modify the request to work on localhost and/or proxy?
looks like I can't make a request outside of a production or content staging url. slight bummer but should be ok
is the "CMS Hub" product required to access cms-js-rendering? someone who just has the "marketing hub" is askingâ€”they just need it for the blog but want to be able to use react modules
I think they should be able to sign up for CMS Free in order to have access.
ok, cool, thanks

I'm buillding my first JS project in HubSpot and it fails when installing private npm packages. Does HubSpot support buildling with packages from private registries? Is there somewhere I need to configure a secret to access these packages? Thanks in advance.

Hello Vivian - We have a solution for this

Step 1 - Add contents of `.npmrc` file to hs secrets via `hs secrets add NPM_RC` . The awkward thing here is that secrets can only take a single line string. So if you need to have multiple entries they needs to have a `\n` character in them e.g.

```//somewhere-else.com/:_authToken=MYTOKEN \n //somewhere-else-ele.com/:_authToken=MYOTHEROKEN```
Step 2 - add the `NPM_RC` secret key to your `cms-assets.json` - see <https://github.HubSpot.com/cms-js-building-block-examples/reference/secrets.html>

Now when you `hs project upload` our build server will safely include your "npmrc" file during the package installing process. Please let me know if you run into any issues. (edited)
is it possible to reference a theme's variables in a module's CSS file or maybe somehow pass theme data to the module? I'm thinking about how this can be done with CSS+HubL in a normal theme CSS file

I've done this by putting CSS variables at the top of main.css in the :root

Then you can reference the CSS variables in a module just like you would in normal cascading CSS. Because main.css is loaded first you have access to variables in the module CSS
ah, that's a good idea, thanks

Hi Byron, thank you for your prompt and  detailed response.
I have been fiddling with this but I still get the exact same errors as when the `NPM_RC` secret was unset.
my `.npmrc` file looks like this:
```//registry.npmjs.org/:_authToken=${NPM_TOKEN}
access="restricted"
commit-hooks=false
scripts-prepend-node-path=true```
 I substitute the env var and join the lines together to get a value of:
```//registry.npmjs.org/:_authToken=XXXX \n access="restricted" \n commit-hooks=false \n scripts-prepend-node-path=true```
I have also tried omitting everything except the first line.
My `cms-assets.json` looks like:
```{
  "label": "PricePoint Test",
  "outputPath": "",
  "secretNames": ["NPM_RC"]
}```
I have been unable to make any progress.
Update: I no longer need any help with this. Our team has decided to build our own webpage externally and interact with HubSpot via the REST API
